entry.title: We've added 40 new image tools
entry.summary: Team Browserling keeps shipping! Last week we added 20 new text tools and today we just added another 40 new tools to our Image Tools collection. We've done our job and now it's Google's job to index them and rank them well. Here are the new image tools: Explode an Image into Pieces Cut an Image into Strips Add Compression Effect to an Image Convert Text to Pixel Art Convert an Image to Hex Codes Convert Hex Codes to an Image Convert an Image to RGB Values Convert RGB Values to an Image Make an Image Transparent Make an Image Semitransparent View Transparent Image Regions Check if Image is Transparent Generate a Custom Image Generate an Empty Image Add Image Background Remove Image Background Add Image Border Remove Image Border Add Rainbow Filter to Image Add Sepia Filter to Image Add Symmetry to an Image Add Padding to an Image Add a Watermark to an Image Add Stroke to an Image Convert WebP to Bitmap Convert Bitmap to WebP Convert WebP to JPG Convert JPG to WebP Convert WebP to PNG Convert PNG to WebP Convert WebP to GIF Convert GIF to WebP Convert Base64 to WebP Convert WebP to Base64 Censor an Image Upscale an Image Downscale an Image Compress an Image Annotate an Image Analyze an Image Next week we'll add even more tools. See you then!

entry.title: How to Run Firefox in Firefox (browser in browser)
entry.summary: TLDR: You can run Firefox in Firefox via browserling.com/firefox. This link will open a virtual Firefox browser inside of your Firefox browser so that you can browse while you browse. What Is Firefox? Firefox is a free and open-source web browser developed by the Mozilla Foundation. It uses the Gecko rendering engine, which implements current and anticipated web standards, providing robust performance and customization capabilities. Firefox is known for its emphasis on privacy and security features, including tracking protection and a wide array of extensions for enhanced user experience. What Is a Browser In a Browser? A browser within a browser is a nested browsing interface, where a secondary browser instance operates inside the primary web browser. This is typically achieved through usâ€¦

entry.title: How to Run Chrome in Chrome (browser in browser)
entry.summary: TLDR: You can run Chrome in Chrome via browserling.com/chrome. This link will open a virtual Chrome browser inside of your Chrome browser. What Is Chrome? Chrome is a web browser developed by Google that utilizes the Blink rendering engine and the V8 JavaScript engine. It is known for its fast performance, support for modern web standards, and extensive ecosystem of extensions and web applications. Chrome is available on various operating systems, including Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, and iOS, and it competes with other web browsers in the market for user adoption and market share. What Is a Browser In a Browser? A browser in a browser refers to technology that runs a secondary web browser instance within an existing web browser. This is achieved by running the secondary browser in a vâ€¦
